Abandoned

Abandoning this PR because another PR https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533 for ThermalSubsystem Fans implementation is merged

Isn't this the same as https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533/8 ?
I guess those were abandoned, that is why this is a new commit?
Yeah, I do not know why Ed wants to abandon my patch 😞
Why do we need to fan_tach. Fan speed and PWM values are exposed as sensors under /redfish/v1/Chassis/<id>/Sensors. So this is majorly used for describing the Fan information only.
Done
Why to set the "resourceNotFound" error and then clear later. You can check for presence, If notFound, Then fill in this.
Done

Along with this, I think you need to fill in the dataSouceUri which is linking to corresponding Sensors URI. May be this can be taken as separate patch.


"DataSourceUri":view details "/redfish/v1/Chassis/<ID>/Sensors/<Fan_tach>"
Done
rename to doFanGet
Done

Can you have your CI admin add you to your CI approval list ?

User not approved, see admin, no CI
yes, I got access

In the Redfish schema index it shows this for `SpeedPercent`:

> "This property shall contain the fan speed, in percent units, for this resource. The value of the DataSourceUri property, if present, shall reference a resource of type Sensor with the ReadingType property containing the value `Percent`."

However, the fan_tach value is in RPM. Should this get fan_pwm to get the percent value instead?
yes, fan_pwm will get percent value. I will update to fan_pwm instead of fan_tach.
Ack

Need a lot more here.. I thought there was an association added for chassis <--> fan ?

See https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533/8
Looks good on my system.  Thanks!

This is not working in our system. It is returning 0 Fans.

curl -k https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/ThermalSubsystem/Fans
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/ThermalSubsystem/Fans",
  "@odata.type": "#FanCollection.FanCollection",
  "Members": [],
  "Members@odata.count": 0,
  "Name": "Fans Collection"
}

I don't see path "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm" in our system

busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper GetSubTreePaths sias "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm" 0 1 "xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value"
Call failed: The resource is not found.

We have fans in the path "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory" and the interface is xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Fan

busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper GetSubTreePaths sias "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory" 0 1 xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Fan 
as 6 "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard/fan0" "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard/fan1" "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard/fan2" "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard/fan3" "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard/fan4" "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard/fan5"

For each fan we have an association:
busctl get-property -j xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Manager /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis/motherboard/fan0 xyz.openbmc_project.Association.Definitions Associations sensors
{
	“type” : “a(sss)“,
	“data” : [
		[
			“sensors”,
			“inventory”,
			“/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/fan0_0"
		],

This association is described at
https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/sensor-architecture.md#association-names-1

Any update on this commit?

I was reviewing the old commit at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533
and noticed that it retrieves the fans collection by looking at the associations of {cooling, cooled_by} and {sensors, inventory}. This approach doesn't rely on a specific path, which is more flexible than this implementation. 

I'm considering reopening the old commit and continuing the work on the association based approach. I would like to suggest that you enhance the inventory to include associations if they are currently missing.

Please let me know if you have any concerns or alternative suggestions.

As Fru information of Fans is not present in Fan inventory so I am using Sensor value to show Fans

busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper GetSubTreePaths sias "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory" 0 1 xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Fan
as 0

We have fans in the path "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors" and the interfance is xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value

busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper GetSubTreePaths sias "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm" 0 1 "xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value"
as 6 "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_11_12" 
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_1_2" 
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_3_4" 
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_5_6" 
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_7_8" 
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_9_10"

For each Fan association is:

busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.FanSensor /xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_1_2 xyz.openbmc_project.Association.Definitions Associations
a(sss) 1 "chassis" "all_sensors" "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/Board

The Associations is not implemented here I will update that in later

The commit https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533 is only for FanCollection but this commit is for both Fan Collection and instance

In Sensors code, ref link is https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/redfish-core/lib/sensors.hpp#L77. I Referred from this and get fan_pwm from xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value

Note: If Fan fru information is populated into Fan Inventory try to update xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value into xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Fan and then check the fans (only fan_pwm will show)

These are series of commits fan collection and fan instance:
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57559
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/41086
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57628
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57630
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57657

We are currently working on association-based implementations for PowerSupply and Fabric Adapter ports. I have requested George to reopen the above mentioned commits so that we can continue with the association-based approach. Let's collaborate on the implementation and testing of this feature.

We need to update the documentation to include fan_pwm in sensorPaths.
Dileep/Jason, I have added you as a reviewer for the mentioned above commits. Please let me know if you are okay with the changes and if they work in your environment.

The above mentioned commits is not working in our system. It shows 0 Fans
get: https://${bmcip}/redfish/v1/Chassis/{id}/ThermalSubsystem/Fans
{
    "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Chassis/{id}/ThermalSubsystem/Fans",
    "@odata.type": "#FanCollection.FanCollection",
    "Description": "The collection of Fan resource instances",
    "Members": [],
    "Members@odata.count": 0,
    "Name": "Fan Collection"
}

As Fru information of Fans is not present in Fan inventory, The fans may not shows
busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper GetSubTreePaths sias "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory" 0 1 xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Fan
as 0

The Fans details are present under interface xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value
fan_pwm sensors are 
busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper GetSubTreePaths sias "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm" 0 1 "xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value"
as 6 "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_11_12"
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_1_2"
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_3_4"
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_5_6"
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_7_8"
"/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_pwm/Pwm_9_10"

fan_tach sensors are
busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper GetSubTreePaths sias "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach" 0 1 "xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value"
as 12 "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_1" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_10" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_11" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_12" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_2" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_3" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_4" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_5" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_6" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_7" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_8" "/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/fan_tach/Fan_9"
It is good to see interest in this from multiple companies, can we converge on either this commit or https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533 ?
Dileep, are  you listing Fans or Sensors?

I need to show Fans only, but as fan fru inventory is not available in our oem so I have took fans from "xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value".
From "xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value" interface, i took all other interfaces and from there i am getting those data from dbus ex: "xyz.openbmc_project.State.Decorator.OperationalStatus"
For now i didn't added location, Asset and other interfaces data because of not present not our oem
As previous comments i have added fan_pwm only
Is everyone good with converging on the https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533/ stack?
I prefer this patch (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533/ ) because it is part of the topic (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/q/topic:redfish-fan)

I'm good with converging on that stack, as fan inventory makes sense for this feature and sounds like the direction the community prefers.

We would appreciate any pointers on what component creates the fan inventory, so we can figure out why it's missing on our systems. Thanks!

We create Fan interface in the following code
https://github.com/openbmc/openpower-vpd-parser/blob/3fb026386546cfd288ab4f86156c9aa0ffa145d6/vpd_tool_impl.cpp#L339

FAN_INTERFACE is the Meson option:
https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aopenbmc+%22FAN_INTERFACE%22&type=code

@Dileep

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533/ has been merged, could you abandon this patch?
Thank you George, Abandoning this patch because https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57533 patch has ThermalSubsystem Fans implementation and merged
#include <memory> ?
warning please
sensorInterface might be a better name

I don't see this hierarchy listed

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Sensor/Value.interface.yaml#L4

This is the sensor path
https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/redfish-core/lib/sensors.hpp#L78 

This commit is searching the sensor path and listing sensors as fans.
As fan fru information is not present in our oem i have got interfaces and services from Sensor and updated the data
#include <boost/system/error_code.hpp> ?
by reference please https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61013
Can you use dbus::utility::getSubTree ?
don't you have this defined above?
by reference please
error_code by reference please https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61013
ERROR probably makes more sense here see https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/DEVELOPING.md#logging-levels
error_code by reference please https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61013
ERROR probably makes more sense here see https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/DEVELOPING.md#logging-levels
We typically don't use the ternary operator in bmcweb. I think you already have a default, so can you just do like https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/62446 ?
Warning here please
#include <functional> ? Might want to run https://include-what-you-use.org/
What about head methods?
